alert.note: Alert for Washington (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 11 at 8:39AM EDT until July 11 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Mettawee River At Granville. * WHEN...Until late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Minor flood stage. Widespread flooding of fields along the river. Water on Upper Turnpike Road and Gray Lane. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:16 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 7.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this morning and continue falling to 5.5 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.2 feet on 05/14/1990. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Mettawee River Granville Flood Stage: 7.0 Observed Stage at Tue 8 am: 7.2 Forecast: Tue 2 pm 6.9 Tue 8 pm 6.6 Wed 2 am 6.4 Wed 8 am 6.3 Wed 2 pm 6.1 Wed 8 pm 6.0 Thu 2 am 5.9 Thu 8 am 5.8 Thu 2 pm 5.7 Thu 8 pm 5.6 Fri 2 am 5.5 &&
